page.title: 06 Wild fowling
page.content: Wild fowling takes place on the saltings on the western margins of Motney Hill by permission of Southern Water Authority,who own the area.The area of the actual Motney Hill peninsula is used as a bird reserve and no shooting is allowed there at any season.The Kent Wildfowlers Assoc. controls the area.Birds such as Canada geese,mallards,various waders,and dunlins can be found at various times of the year and many species breed in the district.The large numbers of birds and their young attract many foxes and other predators and cosequently this rather desolate seeming peninsula has a wide range of fauna.
